metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5729 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
MIT krb5 1.6 or later allows an authenticated kadmin with permission to addprincipals to an LDAP Kerberos database to cause a denial of service (NULLpointer dereference) or bypass a DN container check by supplying taggeddata that is internal to the database module.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.16.1-1
krb5-gss-samples - 1.16.1-1
krb5-k5tls - 1.16.1-1
krb5-kdc - 1.16.1-1
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.16.1-1
krb5-kpropd - 1.16.1-1
krb5-locales - 1.16.1-1
krb5-multidev - 1.16.1-1
krb5-otp - 1.16.1-1
krb5-pkinit - 1.16.1-1
krb5-user - 1.16.1-1
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.16.1-1
libgssrpc4 - 1.16.1-1
libk5crypto3 - 1.16.1-1
libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.16.1-1
libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.16.1-1
libkdb5-9 - 1.16.1-1
libkrad0 - 1.16.1-1
libkrb5-3 - 1.16.1-1
libkrb5support0 - 1.16.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.16.1-1').
